meanings.sent1: She accidentally overdried her clothes, making them stiff and wrinkled.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to overdry your hair with the blow dryer.
meanings.sent3: The cookies were so overdried that they crumbled into dust when touched.
meanings.sent4: His sense of humor was like overdrying a delicate flower, leaving it wilted and lifeless.
meanings.sent5: The desert sun overdrying the land until it cracked and split apart.

meanings.definition: The act of drying something excessively.
meanings.sent1: Overdrying can lead to damage to fabrics and materials.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the overdrying of the paint caused it to peel off the walls.
meanings.sent3: The chef's obsession with overdrying the meat resulted in a tough and unappetizing dish.
meanings.sent4: The overdrying of the riverbed left it barren and lifeless.
meanings.sent5: The overdrying of the flowers in the vase made them brittle and fragile.
